  • Astronomical Reference Data (astropack.reference)

Astronomical Reference Data (astropack.reference)

A few useful numerical constants, format-conversion strings, and unicode special characters that the author has found useful to several recent projects.

Users are very welcome to suggest additions to this embryonic list.

Reference/API

astropack.reference Module

Constants: numerical, astronomical, datetime formats, and special characters.

Variables

ARCSECONDS_PER_RADIAN

float, about 206265

CH_ALMOST_EQUAL

‚âà Almost-equal sign

CH_APPROX_EQUAL

‚âÖ Approximately-equal sign

CH_BULLET_POINT

  • Unicode bullet point (unordered list) character

CH_CLOUD_BLACK

‚òÅ Unicode cloud character

CH_COMET

‚òÑ Unicode comet character

CH_COPYRIGHT

¬© Copyright character

CH_DEGREE

¬∞ Unicode degree sign

CH_IDENTICAL_TO

‚â° Identical-to sign (also used to mean 'is defined as')

CH_INFINITY

‚àû Unicode infinity character

CH_MICRO

¬µ Unicode micro (mu) sign

CH_MOON

‚òΩ Unicode moon character, works with matplotlib graphics package (unlike U0001F319 = üåô)

CH_MUCH_GREATER_THAN

¬ª Much-greater-than sign

CH_MUCH_LESS_THAN

¬´ Much-less-than sign

CH_NOT_EQUAL

‚â† Not-equal sign

CH_PLUS_MINUS

¬± Unicode plus-minus sign

CH_STAR_BLACK

‚òÖ Unicode black (filled) star character

CH_STAR_WHITE

‚òÜ Unicode white (empty) star character

CH_SUN_BLACK

‚òÄ Unicode sun character

DAYS_PER_YEAR_NOMINAL

float, equals 365.25

DEGREES_PER_RADIAN

float, about 57.396

FORMAT_ISO_8601

string, strict ISO 8601, same as 'FITS' format, yielding e.g., '2022-04-02T12:34:42.432'

FORMAT_ISO_8601_HUMAN

string, common ISO 8601, slightly more human-readable format, yielding e.g., '2022-04-02 12:34:42.432'

FWHM_PER_SIGMA

float, about 2.35482

RADIANS_PER_DEGREE

float, about 1/57.396

SECONDS_PER_SIDEREAL_DAY

float, equals 86164.0905
